texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: redhat
texts.text: redhat

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Come to the Czech Republic and discover the beautiful city of  Brno . I just wrapped up my third visit to the city and I can't wait to come back! The city is full of history, culture, and delicious food.
texts.text: Come to the Czech Republic and discover the beautiful city of  Brno . I just wrapped up my third visit to the city and I can't wait to come back! The city is full of history, culture, and delicious food.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Here's my travel guide to Brno!
texts.text: Here's my travel guide to Brno!

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Getting to Brno
texts.text: Getting to Brno

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Brno has  an airport , but the flights are limited and sometimes expensive. Some coworkers have found good deals on these flights (especially via Ryanair from London's Stansted Airport), but I prefer the train.
texts.text: Brno has  an airport , but the flights are limited and sometimes expensive. Some coworkers have found good deals on these flights (especially via Ryanair from London's Stansted Airport), but I prefer the train.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I prefer to fly into Vienna, Austria and catch the  Regiojet  train from Vienna's main train station (Hauptbanhof, or Hbf.) to Brno's main train station (hlavní nádraží). The train is usually €10 or less and it takes about 90 minutes. You can get snacks or a full meal on the train. They also have beer, wine, and coffee (the coffee is free!). They take credit cards on the train for anything you buy.
texts.text: I prefer to fly into Vienna, Austria and catch the  Regiojet  train from Vienna's main train station (Hauptbanhof, or Hbf.) to Brno's main train station (hlavní nádraží). The train is usually €10 or less and it takes about 90 minutes. You can get snacks or a full meal on the train. They also have beer, wine, and coffee (the coffee is free!). They take credit cards on the train for anything you buy.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The only downside of the Regiojet train is that you will need to take a train from Vienna's airport train station (Flughafen) to Vienna's main train station (Wien Hauptbanhof). It's a quick 15 minute trip that costs €5 or less.
texts.text: The only downside of the Regiojet train is that you will need to take a train from Vienna's airport train station (Flughafen) to Vienna's main train station (Wien Hauptbanhof). It's a quick 15 minute trip that costs €5 or less.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: There is also an  ÖBB Railjet  train that leaves directly from Vienna's airport train station (Flughafen Hbf.). It's convenient since you don't need to take a train from the airport to the main train station, but it usually costs €20 or more.
texts.text: There is also an  ÖBB Railjet  train that leaves directly from Vienna's airport train station (Flughafen Hbf.). It's convenient since you don't need to take a train from the airport to the main train station, but it usually costs €20 or more.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Getting around Brno
texts.text: Getting around Brno

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Brno has an  extensive  tram, bus, and train system that runs 24 hours a day. You have plenty of options for getting tickets for trams and buses:
texts.text: Brno has an  extensive  tram, bus, and train system that runs 24 hours a day. You have plenty of options for getting tickets for trams and buses:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: At most stops, you can get a 24 hour ticket with coins (more on money later)
texts.text: At most stops, you can get a 24 hour ticket with coins (more on money later)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The main train station has passes for multiple days (5 days, 14 days,
texts.text: The main train station has passes for multiple days (5 days, 14 days,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Purchase tickets on
texts.text: Purchase tickets on

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Some buses and trams have a contactless card terminal on them (but don't
texts.text: Some buses and trams have a contactless card terminal on them (but don't

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Send SMS to buy tickets (see signs at stops, requires Czech phone number)
texts.text: Send SMS to buy tickets (see signs at stops, requires Czech phone number)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Don't get on without a valid ticket!  When they check for tickets (and they do!), you could get hit with a fine of €15-€40. That's downright silly when a two week ticket is usually around €11.
texts.text: Don't get on without a valid ticket!  When they check for tickets (and they do!), you could get hit with a fine of €15-€40. That's downright silly when a two week ticket is usually around €11.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Buying tickets in Brno's main train station is generally easy, but it costs more than using BrnoID.
texts.text: Buying tickets in Brno's main train station is generally easy, but it costs more than using BrnoID.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: As for tram and bus etiquette, I've learned a few things:
texts.text: As for tram and bus etiquette, I've learned a few things:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Try move away from the doors when you board (sometimes this is difficult
texts.text: Try move away from the doors when you board (sometimes this is difficult

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Make room for people in wheelchairs and with baby carriages in the doorway
texts.text: Make room for people in wheelchairs and with baby carriages in the doorway

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Offer up your seat to the elderly or to people who really need
texts.text: Offer up your seat to the elderly or to people who really need

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Make your way towards the door early and press the green button on the poles
texts.text: Make your way towards the door early and press the green button on the poles

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: If you ride in the late evening or night time, you may hear
texts.text: If you ride in the late evening or night time, you may hear

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: When you want to board the train, be sure to push the buttons next to the
texts.text: When you want to board the train, be sure to push the buttons next to the

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: The cars in the rear of the trams seem to be the least crowded
texts.text: The cars in the rear of the trams seem to be the least crowded

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you only remember one thing, remember this:  trams always have the right of way . As my coworker in Brno says "cars stop, trams do not". Do not assume that the trams will stop in front of you, even at stations. Stay out of the way until the tram has fully passed you or fully stopped.
texts.text: If you only remember one thing, remember this:  trams always have the right of way . As my coworker in Brno says "cars stop, trams do not". Do not assume that the trams will stop in front of you, even at stations. Stay out of the way until the tram has fully passed you or fully stopped.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The trams stop just before 11PM, so be sure to check the schedules or Google Maps prior to heading out at night time. The night buses run all night long but there are some long gaps between stops late at night. The night buses are quite lively, so please don't get distracted and forget about my  na znamení note above. 😀
texts.text: The trams stop just before 11PM, so be sure to check the schedules or Google Maps prior to heading out at night time. The night buses run all night long but there are some long gaps between stops late at night. The night buses are quite lively, so please don't get distracted and forget about my  na znamení note above. 😀

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Speaking Czech
texts.text: Speaking Czech

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I'm an American who speaks English and limited Spanish, and Czech is a difficult language for me. There are sounds in Czech that are totally new to you and they will take a lot of practice before you get them right. However, Czech people are really pleased when you make an attempt to speak  some Czech, so it's worth knowing a few things:
texts.text: I'm an American who speaks English and limited Spanish, and Czech is a difficult language for me. There are sounds in Czech that are totally new to you and they will take a lot of practice before you get them right. However, Czech people are really pleased when you make an attempt to speak  some Czech, so it's worth knowing a few things:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: dobrý den: good day
texts.text: dobrý den: good day

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: dobré ráno: good morning
texts.text: dobré ráno: good morning

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ahoj: hello (and goodbye) for a friend, someone you know
texts.text: ahoj: hello (and goodbye) for a friend, someone you know

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: děkuji: thank you
texts.text: děkuji: thank you

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: prosím: please, can I help you, here you go, casual version of
texts.text: prosím: please, can I help you, here you go, casual version of

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: nemáš zač: you're welcome (more formal)
texts.text: nemáš zač: you're welcome (more formal)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: pivo: beer (follow with
texts.text: pivo: beer (follow with

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: vino: wine (just like Spanish!)
texts.text: vino: wine (just like Spanish!)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If these look difficult, do your best to work on  dobrý den  and  děkuji . In my experience, most people I met would put on a big smile when they heard me try some basic Czech. One of the workers at my hotel saw me every morning and after a few days of me saying "dobrý den" to her before breakfast, she finally said "getting better, good job!" 🤗
texts.text: If these look difficult, do your best to work on  dobrý den  and  děkuji . In my experience, most people I met would put on a big smile when they heard me try some basic Czech. One of the workers at my hotel saw me every morning and after a few days of me saying "dobrý den" to her before breakfast, she finally said "getting better, good job!" 🤗

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The vowels in Czech are almost exactly the same as Spanish (including accented ones). If you see a consonant with a hat, like č, add an  h  after it. A č sounds like  ch  in chair. A š sounds like  sh  in shut.
texts.text: The vowels in Czech are almost exactly the same as Spanish (including accented ones). If you see a consonant with a hat, like č, add an  h  after it. A č sounds like  ch  in chair. A š sounds like  sh  in shut.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you see a hat on a vowel, like ě, try to mix in a  y  sound like in yarn. These are difficult.
texts.text: If you see a hat on a vowel, like ě, try to mix in a  y  sound like in yarn. These are difficult.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I'm told the most difficult letter is the ř. It's a sound we don't have in Latin languages. I seem to get better at it after a few beers.
texts.text: I'm told the most difficult letter is the ř. It's a sound we don't have in Latin languages. I seem to get better at it after a few beers.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: A friend in Brno told me that you speak Czech like you care a lot about the first syllable and you don't care about the others. Put most of your emphasis on the early part of the word and avoid doing that in the middle and end.
texts.text: A friend in Brno told me that you speak Czech like you care a lot about the first syllable and you don't care about the others. Put most of your emphasis on the early part of the word and avoid doing that in the middle and end.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Food and drinks
texts.text: Food and drinks

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You had better come hungry (and thirsty) because the food here is delicious. Brno has plenty of delicious meats, vegetables, pastries, beer, and wine. Being vegetarian or vegan in Brno isn't exactly easy, but it's entirely possible.
texts.text: You had better come hungry (and thirsty) because the food here is delicious. Brno has plenty of delicious meats, vegetables, pastries, beer, and wine. Being vegetarian or vegan in Brno isn't exactly easy, but it's entirely possible.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My absolute favorite items are bramboraky (thick potato pancakes), trdelník (cake made on a spit), and kolače (round pastry with plum in the middle). Czech people also love cheesecake because you can find it everywhere. Meat dishes like pork knee, rump steak, and beef goulash are top notch.
texts.text: My absolute favorite items are bramboraky (thick potato pancakes), trdelník (cake made on a spit), and kolače (round pastry with plum in the middle). Czech people also love cheesecake because you can find it everywhere. Meat dishes like pork knee, rump steak, and beef goulash are top notch.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: As for drinks, pilsner beer is really popular. You can find beers like Starobrno and Pilsner Urquell everywhere, but I'd encourage you to look for some other beers like Chotěboř (it's a tough one to say). There are lots of microbrweries all over town.
texts.text: As for drinks, pilsner beer is really popular. You can find beers like Starobrno and Pilsner Urquell everywhere, but I'd encourage you to look for some other beers like Chotěboř (it's a tough one to say). There are lots of microbrweries all over town.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Wine in Brno is delicious. Moravia (southern Czech Republic) is full of wineries and they extend into Sloviakia and Croatia. If you enjoy red wine, you are in for a treat. Try a local Cabernet or Frankovka. Even the Merlot wine here tastes amazing. As for white wines, my favorite is the Pálava
texts.text: Wine in Brno is delicious. Moravia (southern Czech Republic) is full of wineries and they extend into Sloviakia and Croatia. If you enjoy red wine, you are in for a treat. Try a local Cabernet or Frankovka. Even the Merlot wine here tastes amazing. As for white wines, my favorite is the Pálava

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you tire of Czech food, Brno has excellent food from around the world, especially Indian, Italian, and Thai food.
texts.text: If you tire of Czech food, Brno has excellent food from around the world, especially Indian, Italian, and Thai food.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Breakfasts include lots of familiar foods, including eggs, bacon, beans, fruit, pastries, coffee, and tea. Filtered coffee (American-style) is hard to come by, but you can order an americano at most coffee shops even if it's not on the menu. Try a good espresso at least once. You can finish it fast and you get a good jolt in a few minutes.
texts.text: Breakfasts include lots of familiar foods, including eggs, bacon, beans, fruit, pastries, coffee, and tea. Filtered coffee (American-style) is hard to come by, but you can order an americano at most coffee shops even if it's not on the menu. Try a good espresso at least once. You can finish it fast and you get a good jolt in a few minutes.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Safety
texts.text: Safety

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I've felt safer in Brno than in some cities in Texas. As with any big city, travel with groups when you can and be sure you know where you're going before you go. Czech people try to keep to themselves on streets and public transportation, so if you're minding your own business, you are most likely never going to be bothered.
texts.text: I've felt safer in Brno than in some cities in Texas. As with any big city, travel with groups when you can and be sure you know where you're going before you go. Czech people try to keep to themselves on streets and public transportation, so if you're minding your own business, you are most likely never going to be bothered.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Money
texts.text: Money

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The Czechs use Koruna ("crowns" in English). Amounts are usually shown in full units (no cents like with US dollars) and there are coins for 50 CZK and lower. The bills start at 100 CZK.
texts.text: The Czechs use Koruna ("crowns" in English). Amounts are usually shown in full units (no cents like with US dollars) and there are coins for 50 CZK and lower. The bills start at 100 CZK.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I recommend using an ATM when you arrive since you'll get the best rate. However, stay away from the ATMs that are very close to the train station. I've seen fees as high as €10 at ATMs near the station! The city center is a few blocks away with plenty of ATMs with little or no fees.
texts.text: I recommend using an ATM when you arrive since you'll get the best rate. However, stay away from the ATMs that are very close to the train station. I've seen fees as high as €10 at ATMs near the station! The city center is a few blocks away with plenty of ATMs with little or no fees.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: As with most of Europe, cards are widely accepted. Chip cards are required and contactless cards are really helpful. Most payment terminals will allow you to pay with a quick tap of your contactless card and it's quite handy. American cards still require a signature and you may find that Czech people are stunned when their payment terminal demands that they collect a signature from you.
texts.text: As with most of Europe, cards are widely accepted. Chip cards are required and contactless cards are really helpful. Most payment terminals will allow you to pay with a quick tap of your contactless card and it's quite handy. American cards still require a signature and you may find that Czech people are stunned when their payment terminal demands that they collect a signature from you.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Before you travel, be sure to let your credit and debit card companies know about your travel so that you won't trigger fraud alerts.
texts.text: Before you travel, be sure to let your credit and debit card companies know about your travel so that you won't trigger fraud alerts.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Enjoy
texts.text: Enjoy

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I've probably missed a lot of things in this post, but these are the things that come to mind right now. Thanks for reading the post and I hope you get to enjoy a trip to Brno soon!
texts.text: I've probably missed a lot of things in this post, but these are the things that come to mind right now. Thanks for reading the post and I hope you get to enjoy a trip to Brno soon!
